cmake --build . --config %CMAKE_CONFIG% --target INSTALL
if errorlevel 1 exit 1

ctest --output-on-failure --timeout 100

comments.body:
I've got too many failures:

```
96% tests passed, 15 tests failed out of 405

Total Test time (real) = 715.81 sec

The following tests FAILED:
          1 - pysidetest_application_test (Failed)
          4 - pysidetest_enum_test (Failed)
         21 - signals_disconnect_test (Failed)
         60 - QtCore_bug_515 (Failed)
        108 - QtCore_qbytearray_test (Timeout)
        141 - QtCore_qresource_test (Failed)
        300 - QtGui_qpixmap_constructor (Failed)
        305 - QtGui_qradialgradient_test (Failed)
        312 - QtGui_qtableview_test (Failed)
        326 - QtGui_repr_test (Failed)
        341 - QtNetwork_udpsocket_test (Failed)
        343 - QtWebKit_bug_448 (Failed)
        350 - QtWebKit_shouldInterruptjavascript_test (Timeout)
        362 - QtOpenGL_qglbuffer_test (Failed)
        365 - QtSql_qsqldatabaseandqueries_test (Failed)
Errors while running CTest
```

PySide is known for being buggy (that's why we don't support it anymore in Spyder 3.0), but people still want to use it because of its liberal license.

So we shouldn't demand @jschueller to fix these bugs :-) However, @jschueller please add a comment about why `ctest` is not activated.
